prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular cutout The first part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular cutout on one side. The prism has a flat bottom and a flat top. The cutout is also flat and has a smaller flat bottom. The prism is symmetrical along its central axis. Sketch: Face 1 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.075, 0.0] 2. Draw a closed loop on the X-Y plane with the following lines and arcs: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1875] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.75, 0.1875], End Point [0.6, 0.3375], Mid Point [0.675, 0.2625] - Line 3: Start Point [0.6, 0.3375], End Point [0.375, 0.3375] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.3375], End Point [0.225, 0.1875], Mid Point [0.3075, 0.2625] - Line 4: Start Point [0.225, 0.1875], End Point [0.075, 0.3375] - Arc 3: Start Point [0.075, 0.3375], End Point [0.0, 0.2625], Mid Point [0.0375, 0.3075] - Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.2625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrusion: 3. Scale the sketch using the sketch_scale parameter: 0.75 4. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.075 units. 5. The result will create a new solid body representing part 1 of the final shape. Dimensions: - length: 0.75 units - width: 0.075 units - height: 0.075 units</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** * Set the euler angles to (0°, 0°, -90°). * Set the translation vector to (0, 0.2502, 0). 2. **Create a new sketch.** * The sketch should be drawn on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. **Create Line 1.** * Set the start point to (0, 0). * Set the end point to (0.75, 0). 4. **Create Line 2.** * Set the start point to (0.75, 0). * Set the end point to (0.75, 0.3658). 5. **Create Line 3.** * Set the start point to (0.75, 0.3658). * Set the end point to (0, 0.3658). 6. **Create Line 4.** * Set the start point to (0, 0.3658). * Set the end point to (0, 0). 7. **Close the loop.** * This forms a single face. 8. **Scale the sketch.** * Set the scaling factor to 0.75. 9. **Extrude the scaled sketch.** * Extrude the sketch by 0.1251 units in the positive Z direction. This will create the prism. * The height of the prism should be 0.5 (0.75) units, including the sloped side. * The width should be 0.1251 units. * The length should be 0.75 units. Part 2: Two Cylindrical Holes Construct a metallic container or vase with two cylindrical portions. The tapered top will resemble that of a vase, while the bottom part of the container will have a flat bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** * Set the euler angles to (0°, 0°, -90°). * Set the translation vector to (0.1005, 0.1251, 0.1555). 2. **Create a new sketch.** * The first sketch should be drawn on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. **Create Circle 1.** * Set the center to (0.0274, 0.0274). * Set the radius to 0.0274. 4. **Create a second sketch.** * The second sketch should be drawn on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. 5. **Create Circle 2.** * Set the center to (0.2775, 0.0274). * Set the radius to 0.0274. 6. **Scale the sketches.** * Scale both sketches by ```diff - 0.3049. 7. Extrude each scaled sketch. - Extrude Circle 1 by 0.1251 units in the positive Z direction. - Extrude Circle 2 by 0.1251 units in the positive Z direction. - This will create the cylindrical portions of the container. - The width of the container should be ~0.1251 units. - The height of the container should be approximately 0.3049 units for each circle. + The length (0.3049) of the container will be determined by the combination of both circles. ```</description>

Draw a circle with a center at [0.1793, 0.1569] and a radius of 0.061. **Loop 3:** 1. Draw a circle with a center at [0.1793, 0.6145] and a radius of 0.0458. **Loop 4:** 1. Draw a circle with a center at [0.6548, 0.4314] and a radius of 0.0458. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7299. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Using the same coordinate system, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch in the direction of the normal by a depth of 0.061 and no extrusion in the opposite direction.
